articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance by Ensemble of KPA Navy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance by Ensemble of KPA Navy
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, enjoyed a performance given by the Song and Dance Ensemble of the Navy of the KPA.
					 Colorful performance included "Hoist the Supreme Commander's Colors", "My Warship Is the Land of the Country Dear to Me", "Pleased to Have Defended the Sea of the Country", "Our Army, Our People" and "Death Defying Corps on the Sea."
					
					The performers enthusiastically sang of the invincible might of the heroic KPA grown to be matchless forces under the loving care of Kim Jong Il and powerfully demonstrated the iron faith and the indomitable will of the KPA soldiers to accomplish with arms the revolutionary cause of Juche started in the forest of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction over the splendid performance staged by the artistes of the ensemble with works of high ideological and artistic value and highly appreciated their successful presentation, extending thanks to them.
					
					 He highly praised them for their work style, noting that they have conducted dynamic performing activities, instilling confidence of sure victory, optimism and the courage and will to wipe out the enemy into soldiers.
					
					 He expressed the expectation and belief that the creators and artistes of the ensemble would more dynamically conduct the revolutionary and militant performing activities to positively contribute to educating the soldiers in a revolutionary manner.
					
					 Among the audience were senior party and army officials Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Hong Sok Hyong, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and Col. General Han Tong Gun.

articles.title: S. Korean Urged to Stop Their Moves for Confrontation and War
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Stop Their Moves for Confrontation and War
						
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' pursuance of the policy for confrontation and war is a treacherous one and leads to their self-destruction, warns Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined article.
					 It continues:
					
					The large-scale Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged by the south Korean authorities in collaboration with outside forces are intolerable treachery as they brought the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase and brought the danger of a nuclear war to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 They staged the joint saber-rattling aimed at mounting a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK in collaboration with America at a time when the improvement of the inter-Korean ties presents itself as a more urgent issue than ever before. It admits of no argument that this is a deliberate move to deteriorate the north-south ties. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are gravely mistaken. They go reckless, without properly knowing who their rival is.
					
					 They are vociferating about somebody's "contingency" but it can never happen in the DPRK. Their saber-rattling is as foolish an act as precipitating their own self-destruction. 
					
					 The DPRK sets store by the improved inter-Korean relations but will never remain a passive onlooker to the reckless war moves of the trigger-happy elements keen to bring them to collapse and step up their moves for confrontation and war. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities keep pursuing the policy for confrontation and war, defying the need of the times and desire of all the fellow countrymen, they will not be able to escape the nation's stern judgment.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Conclude FTA Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Conclude FTA Denounced
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on March 8 carried the results of the opinion poll conducted as regards the clinched additional deal for the conclusion of south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement".
					 53.1 percent of 654 employees and students polled expressed opposition to the conclusion of FTA, the paper said. 
					
					 They said that FTA was an agreement beneficial to the U.S. only and it would facilitate social polarization, the paper added.

articles.title: S. Korean Diplomats' Scandals under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Diplomats' Scandals under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Tong A Ilbo on Friday editorially accused the south Korean diplomatic officials of their irregularities and corruption. 
					 Diplomats seized with the consciousness of privileges are more keen on serving their masters and getting more public funds than pursuing diplomacy while riding roughshod over people, the editorial noted, and went on:
					
					 It was disclosed that there were chiefs of diplomatic missions who expropriated public money by increasing the number of persons present at dinners given at embassy offices and diplomats pocketed public money by falsifying the period of their official trips. There are also diplomats who issued visas after receiving bribes from brokers, diplomats who got public money by forging papers for the purchase of houses or cars and there are also diplomats who used official cars as their private ones. 
					
					 But the south Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade has been busy to cover up all these wrongs or has shut its eyes to them though it knows about them better than any others. 
					
					 The Committee for Foreign Affairs and Trade and Unification of the National Assembly of south Korea lets several groups tour different countries whenever inspection of state administration is conducted but they consider it as the most important program to attend dinners given by ambassadors to the relevant countries. 
					
					 The ministry officially declared it would bring about a radical change in appointing diplomats, estimating their work and posting, etc. when there was a suspicion of the special appointment of the daughter of the then Minister Ryu Myong Hwan last year. But with the flow of time the promised reform including appointment and training of diplomats ended up in an anticlimax.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Treachery under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Treachery under Fire 
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea released a commentary denouncing the authorities' treachery on March 9. 
					 The commentary said: At a session of the "National Assembly" on March 8 it was disclosed that the Ministry of Land and Seas changed by stealth the name of "Tokdo" (Tok Islets) Comprehensive Marine Science Base into "Tonghae" (East Sea) Comprehensive Marine Science Base. 
					
					 This disclosure touched off strong criticism among people from all walks of life, it noted.
					
					 The commentary accused the authorities of letting the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade make people gradually forget Tok Islets. 
					
					 Japan is becoming evermore persistent and undisguised in its ambition to grab Tok Islets, it said, expressing the hope that the "government" will stop trying to make Tok Islets fade away from the minds of people but make them forget Japan.

articles.title: Withdrawal of Military Reform Plan Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Military Reform Plan Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a news conference outside the puppet Defense Ministry in demand of the withdrawal of the deceptive military reform plan of the military authorities on March 9. 
					 Speakers noted at the news conference that the military authorities confirmed the "military reform plan 307," adding that it was the worst plan in history as it is meant to boost the authority of the military.
					
					 They held that if the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff is invested with more powerful authority than what the erstwhile dictatorial regimes attempted to grant, this will leave the whole society subject to the military and deal a telling blow at the movement for democratization. 
					
					 The attempt of the military authorities to introduce huge war hardware through the military reform would lead to beefing up armed forces and finally result in excessive arms expansion, they charged. 
					
					 They demanded the military authorities cancel the plan at once. 
					
					 That day, the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea released a commentary critical of the "military reform plan 307".

articles.title: Son Hak Gyu on Root Cause of Increasing Tension
articles.content:
Son Hak Gyu on Root Cause of Increasing Tension
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Son Hak Gyu, representative of the south Korean Democratic Party, said that the high-handed policy pursued by the present regime toward the north is the main cause of increasing tension on the Korean Peninsula, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 He said he cannot but express his concern about the United States which keeps mum about the Lee Myung Bak's "policy toward the north" and agrees with it.

articles.title: More Brisk Dissemination of Juche Idea Called for in Bangladesh
articles.content:
More Brisk Dissemination of Juche Idea Called for in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre discussed a plan for more earnestly studying and disseminating the Juche idea on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The centre at an annual meeting held in Dhaka on March 7 reviewed its activities conducted last year.
					
					 Chairman of the Centre Garib Newaz in his speech made at the meeting said that the Juche idea is a guiding principle to be invariably adhered to for accomplishing the cause of independence of the popular masses.
					
					 He called for intensifying the activities to deeply study the Juche idea and follow the examples set by the DPRK.

articles.title: Regional Body Praises Kim Jong Suk's Good Marksmanship
articles.content:
Regional Body Praises Kim Jong Suk's Good Marksmanship
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted an article introducing anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk on its Internet homepage on the International Women's Day.
					It carried it on March 6 under the title "Echo of Revolution in Lagoon Samil" with a photo of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The article dealt in detail with the fact that Kim Jong Suk visited Lagoon Samil together with Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Sept. 28 1947 and showed her mysterious skill as a sharp shooter.
					
					 At that time, Kim Il Sung fired a revolver first and then handed it to Kim Jong Suk who hit the target at a single shot without showing any sign of sighting, the article noted, and continued: When officials gave her cheers, she told them that she, as a revolutionary soldier of Kim Il Sung, should remain unchanged in her good marksmanship because she has still a long way to go for the Korean revolution.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Military Maneuvers Condemned
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Military Maneuvers Condemned
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea issued a statement on March 8 demanding a halt to the U.S.-S. Korea joint military exercises.
					 The statement scathingly condemned the military maneuvers, a main factor of escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The committee, reflecting the unanimous will of the world peace-loving people, urges the U.S. and south Korea to stop at once the military maneuvers straining the situation on the peninsula and increasing the danger of war in the region, it said.
					
					 The committee called on all the progressives supporting the cause of independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, the desire of the Korean people, to denounce the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises and turn out in actions for putting an immediate end to them, concluded the statement.

articles.title: China and Russia Agree to Work Together for Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
China and Russia Agree to Work Together for Six-Party Talks
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- China and Russia agreed to work together for the resumption of the six-party talks. 
					This agreement was adopted at talks between Special Representative of the Chinese Government for the Korean Peninsula Issue Wu Dawei and Russian Vice Foreign Minister Aleksei Borodavkin on March 10, according to Jiji Press.
					
					 Wu Dawei expressed the view that China would "not accept any preconditions" put up as regards the resumption of the six-party talks, it added.

articles.title: Iran Slams US, EU for Their Stands on Its Nuclear Activities
articles.content:
Iran Slams US, EU for Their Stands on Its Nuclear Activities 
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Ali-Asghar Soltanieh, Iran's envoy to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), lashed out on March 9 at the U.S. and EU for questioning the nature of his country's peaceful nuclear activities. 
					 "The Unites States and EU have once again repeated the unfounded assertion questioning the exclusive peaceful nature of our nuclear activities without presenting any authenticated evidence," Soltanieh told the ongoing IAEA board meeting.
					
					 "They are trying to divert the attention from the real threat to global peace and security, namely from hundreds of nuclear weapons deployed in Europe by the United States of America," he said.

articles.title: IAEA under Political Influence--Iran
articles.content:
IAEA under Political Influence--Iran
 Tehran, March 11 (KCNA) -- In the wake of the latest report by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), Iran says a certain double-edged position in the report on the nuclear issue of Iran indicates the agency is still influenced by political pressure.
					Iranian Foreign Ministry Spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast told reporters on Tuesday.
					
					 He noted that the political pressure on the IAEA is aimed at diverting the agency from its primary responsibilities towards "meeting the objectives of certain countries."

articles.title: Chinese National People's Congress Meets
articles.content:
Chinese National People's Congress Meets
 Beijing, March 11 (KCNA) -- Chairman Wu Bangguo delivered a report on the work of the Standing Committee of the 11th National People's Congress (NPC) to the parliament's annual session held at the Great Hall of the People on Thursday.
					 Wu said in the report that the Standing Committee of the NPC organically unified the thorough implementation of the outlook on scientific development, adherence to the leadership of the party and the governance of the country on the basis of making the people become masters and the rule of law and formulated or revised important laws last year.
					
					 This year the NPC Standing Committee should exercise power on the basis of law, having the situation of the party and state work in the centre, and bring about a phase favorable for the economic and social development during the period of the Twelfth Five-Year Plan and thus contribute to achieving social harmony and stability, he added.

articles.title: Colombian President on Role of Women
articles.content:
Colombian President on Role of Women 
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos referred to the role of women Tuesday on the occasion of the International Women's Day.
					 He said women will play an important role in his administration to help eradicate extreme poverty in the country.

articles.title: Guarantee of Women's Rights Called for by Mexican President
articles.content:
Guarantee of Women's Rights Called for by Mexican President
 Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Mexican President Felipe Calderon in a speech made on the International Women's Day on Tuesday called for ensuring women's rights. 
					 There is still prejudice against women which hampers their full development in Mexico, he said.
					
					 He added that on the occasion of the day, the struggle of millions of women for their liberation should be remembered and women's rights in Mexico be emphasized again.

articles.title: Cuban Paper Slams US Cyber Warfare
articles.content:
Cuban Paper Slams US Cyber Warfare 
 Havana, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Cuban newspaper Granma on March 8 carried an article denouncing the U.S. cyber warfare against Cuba. 
					 The paper disclosed the fact that the U.S. smuggled satellite antennas and other equipment into Cuba to have secret internet connections in a bid to spread false rumors, create social instability and bring Cuba to collapse. 
					
					 Recalling that the U.S. smuggled latest programs into Cuba to form networks not subject to government control and establish a system whereby digitalized files are transmitted and received, the paper went on: The U.S. is leaving no means untried to intensify the anti-Cuba campaign.

articles.title: India Says Killing of Sikhs in US Unfortunate
articles.content:
India Says Killing of Sikhs in US Unfortunate
						
 New Delhi, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Indian government Tuesday said that the killing of two Sikhs in the United States is "unfortunate".
					 Indian Minister of State for External Affairs Preneet Kaur told the media in the national capital that the Indian Embassy in Washington would take up the matter with the U.S. authorities.
